title: suspended for no reason
body: so riot games decided to give me another suspension based on another players behavior and teasing(talking shit before the game starts like u suck ur and idiot etc. 2 players btw ) so naturally as a human being i respond,but everyone has their own border when they say,ive had enough of your shit,so thats what happened,and it looks like for some reason riot blames that on me,not on the 3/10 inting jhin and not on the heimer who was flaming and talking shit the whole game not just to me,to EVERYONE in the game,so i want answers from riot. are u trying to make me quit the game? i tried sending a ticket but the site doesnt work for some reason.

replies.body: If you wish to actually discuss your punishment then please post your entire unedited Reform Card here in this thread. Just note though that you are judged based on your behavior alone and that other people behaving poorly doesn't give you a free pass to do the same.
i mean i expect if i get a suspension over that,then the 2 guys doing something worst would get punished aswell. dont u think so?

> [{quoted}](name=corktable,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=K3jMeN9q,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-06-20T14:38:08.855+0000)
>
> i mean i expect if i get a suspension over that,then the 2 guys doing something worst would get punished aswell. dont u think so?

If you reported them and they have a history of poor behavior then they will be punished just like you were here. Again though "they started it" doesn't work here. From the [IFS FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-): 

>**WHY WAS I PUNISHED WHEN THE OTHER PERSON WAS WORSE OR STARTED IT!**
Simply speaking, retaliation is not an acceptable or justifiable behavior. An argument between two players can easily create a negative experience for the rest of the players in the game with you. Regardless of the other playerâ€™s actions, this does not justify your own behavior. You alone are responsible for your actions within the game.If you encounter a toxic player like this, the best option is to simply report their behavior and move on.
Reports are a vital piece to the puzzle. If you are not sure of what sort of behavior is reportable take a look at the [Reporting a Player FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player)

Ultimately though I must ask you to post your entire unedited reform card if you truly wish to discuss your punishment.

You are only punished for what you say, not what others say. Other people doing something wrong doesn't mean that you get to. Mute them, report them, and move on.

> [{quoted}](name=corktable,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=K3jMeN9q,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-06-20T13:15:14.117+0000)
>
> are u trying to make me quit the game?

If you refuse to reform then yes. If your current punishment is a 14 day suspension then the next punishment if you don't reform will be a permanent suspension.
not a 14day ban,a chat restriction,as far as i know guess what,the heimer didnt get any suspension,cause thats how riot works nowadays, no wonder theres less and less players in the game tbh

First off, how do you know the other player didn't get punished? The notification that someone you recently reported was punished is rarely sent out even if the person you reported is punished.

You don't need to be worried about his behavior because that isn't what got you punished. You need to worry about your own punishment. Currently the system works in tiers:

10 game chat restriction
25 game chat restriction
14 day suspension
permanent suspension

So if you continue as you are you will be punished more severely until you are eventually permanently suspended.

And as far as I am aware there are no official numbers on how the playerbase has changed in recent years, so I have to question why you think there are less and less players?

pms,thats how i know,how do i know there are less and less players? just check twitch,thats how u can already tell the game is about to die out,less and less people watch and play the game even some bigger league streamers arent streaming league anymore(i think we dont need names riot probablly already knows which ones i mean) and thats because of riots balance team and ofc the behavior system which is the biggest bs ever put into the game,ive had multiple people aswell spamming me in pms and ingame with the N word etc(yes i reported even sent a ticket once with screenshots) ,and they still play to this day with no suspensions or bans but because i respond to someone with and i quote "shut the fuck up before u tilt everyone" and he still doesnt stop talking shit and tilting everyone and keeps on literally trying to get a response out of me,and at the end of the game cause i "responded" to him,i get a suspension and back to locked honor level which btw doesnt even change since i get honored literally every game and i dont get past level 0 anymore. riot has to fix the game thats just where its at at the moment. i want a rioters opinion on this 100% just cant wait for them to give that heimer a quick 10day chat suspension and then act all high and mighty about how its "fair"

A lot of people watched pubg over league of legends for a while. What happened to that? 
When overwatch was released, a lot more people watched overwatch on twitch. What happened to that?

I find that twitch can be a representation of how enjoyable a game is to watch but more a sign of what games specific popular streamers are playing. Popular streamers will get tons of views regardless of what game they happen to be playing at the time. Their viewers can often push a game that isn't even in the top 50 most watched to the top 6 if the popular streamer is playing something new.

No, they gave you a suspension based on your own behaviour.

>everyone has their own border when they say,ive had enough of your shit

Yes, and when you hit that you mute them; then report them after the game. If you'd done that the game would have played out exactly the same way, but you wouldn't be here after. That is objectively a better outcome for everyone.

> are u trying to make me quit the game?

They're trying to make you learn this behaviour isn't acceptable. If you can't learn that then yes, they want you to quit.
